name: Hint Rocks
pages: If you don't want to wander around with your prospecting pick testing every inch of the river you can follow this guide to find the best places to prospect for ores.$(br2)If you found a small nugget or a loose stone that doesn't seem to fit with its surroundings you most probably found a underground vein.
Dig arround and test the surrounding soil and see if you find any traces, sometimes the ore can be deep in the soil so don't loose faith!
Hint Rocks: $(br2)A hint rock is what we call loose stones that don't fit the soil around it, it will signal veins of ore that are close to the surface.
